name: Mojito
about: The Mojito originated in Cuba and is one of the country's oldest cocktails. It's believed to have been developed in the 16th century when Sir Francis Drake's crew used a primitive form of the drink to combat scurvy and dysentery.
instructions: Add mint leaves and simple syrup to a highball glass
Gently muddle to release the mint oils without shredding the leaves
Squeeze lime juice into the glass and add the spent lime shells
Fill the glass halfway with crushed ice
Add rum and stir gently to combine
Add more crushed ice to form a mound
Garnish with a mint sprig and lime wheel
notes: The key to a great Mojito is fresh ingredients and gentle muddling. Over-muddling the mint will make it bitter. In Cuba, the mint variety used is 'yerba buena', which has a slightly different flavor than common spearmint.
